stem: The nurse is evaluating clients with hypertensive disorders of pregnancy. For each assessment finding, select whether it is associated with Preeclampsia, Eclampsia, or HELLP Syndrome.

rows.text: Blood pressure â‰¥140/90 mmHg with proteinuria after 20 weeks gestation.
New onset of generalized tonic-clonic seizures.
Elevated liver enzymes (ALT/AST) and right upper quadrant pain.
Hemolysis (low Hgb/Hct) and low platelet count (<100,000).
Severe persistent headache and visual scotoma (blind spots).

rationale.correct: Hypertensive disorders represent a spectrum of vasospastic disease. (r1) Preeclampsia is the baseline diagnostic state. (r2) Eclampsia is defined by the onset of seizures. (r3 & r4) HELLP (Hemolysis, Elevated Liver, Low Platelets) is a severe laboratory-based manifestation involving multi-organ failure. (r5) Severe neuro-symptoms (Headache/Vision) indicate severe preeclampsia or impending eclampsia.
rationale.incorrect: HELLP syndrome can occur without hypertension or proteinuria in up to 15-20% of cases, making it difficult to diagnose without labs.
clinicalPearls: Magnesium sulfate is used for seizure prophylaxis in preeclampsia and seizure management in eclampsia.

questionTrap.howToOvercome: Right upper quadrant pain in a pregnant woman is a liver emergency (HELLP), not just 'gallbladder issues' or 'heartburn'.

mnemonic.title: H-E-L-L-P
mnemonic.expansion: Hemolysis, Elevated Liver enzymes, Low Platelets.

reviewUnits.heading: Hypertensive Disorders of Pregnancy
reviewUnits.body: Nurses monitor Blood Pressure, Deep Tendon Reflexes (DTRs), and urine output. Management requires delivery of the placenta, as it is the source of the pathophysiology.
